f. Domestic Violence
 ∙ The husband and immediate family members of the pregnant woman should be briefed about the serious 
consequences that violence could have on the pregnancy, on the woman’s health and on the physical and 
mental health of the child to be born. The woman herself should be counselled in private and enabled to 
access support systems from within or outside the family, during and after the pregnancy. Health workers 
should be alert to signs of continuing violence
